alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 7:59PM CDT until May 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND NORTHERN COLEMAN COUNTIES... At 756 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had move eastward to May to Owens. Earlier heavy radar estimated rainfall ranged from 3 to 5 inches. This will likely produce flash flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Coleman, Burkett, Grosvenor, Cross Cut, Silver Valley, Byrds, Glen Cove, Echo, Us-283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line, Lake Coleman and Hords Creek Reservoir. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 2273 crossing Rough Branch, County Road 172 crossing Little Pecan Bayou, County Road 485 crossing Indian Creek and County Road 441 crossing Bledsoe Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
